title: Here's what's coming to Hulu in January 2022 — and what's leaving
text:
The biggest splash is “How I Met Your Father” (Jan. 18), the long-awaited, not-quite-sequel to the long-running sitcom “How I Met Your Mother.” Hilary Duff stars this time around as a single young woman in New York City, with an older version of herself (played by Kim Cattrall) narrating the story of how she met her true love — and all the romantic misadventures that preceded that. Two episodes will drop on its premiere date, with new eps every following week.

There's also the original movie “Sex Appeal” (Jan. 14), a teen coming-of-age sex comedy starring Mika Abdalla, and featuring Margaret Cho and Fortune Feimster.

Also: What's coming in January to Netflix | Amazon Prime Video

But while light on originals, the Disney DIS-owned streaming service has a loaded roster of network shows streaming a day after they air, including ABC's new civil-rights drama series “Women of the Movement” (Jan. 7); a new season of “The Bachelor” (Jan. 4); the new grade-school sitcom “Abbott Elementary” (Jan. 4); and season premieres of NBC's “This Is Us” (Jan. 5) and ABC's “Black-ish” (Jan. 6).

Hulu will also bolster its movie offerings, with “Devil in a Blue Dress,” “Last of the Mohicans,” “Midnight in Paris,” “Three Days of the Condor” and six “Star Trek” movies.

Here's the full list of what's coming and going, as of Dec. 19 (release dates are subject to change):
